details.title: Design of frequency modulated waveforms via the Zak transform
details.abstract: This paper introduces a new technique for designing frequency modulated waveforms that have ambiguity functions with desirable properties, such as strong peaking at the origin and low sidelobes. The methods employed involve signal design in the Zak transform space, as well as the use of stationary phase arguments in the analysis of ambiguity functions.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
